New Records: Bam Adebayo posted a game-high 32 points on 12-of-24 shooting, including 3-of-5 from 3-point range in the winning effort.
Key Match Events: Miami dominated the battle on the glass, finishing a plus-21 (65-44)–hauling down 21 offensive rebounds with 21 second-chance points.
Bilal Coulibaly was a standout from Washington’s side, adding a team-high 22 points on 8-of-12 shooting with eight rebounds and two assists.
Pre-Game Insights: The Heat stressed getting Adebayo involved early, scoring seven first-quarter points and 20 in the first half.
Post-Match Reflections: Big_guy305: Hopefully this game will unlock bam for the rest of the season, this game should be the blueprint to get bam rolling by feeding him early, and often.
vagibugi: This was a revival game. Next 10 or so will show, where we are. Positive score after next 10 games will be a good sign.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pelle Larsson got his first real minutes of the season with Duncan Robinson not making the trip.
First-round rookie Kel’el Ware saw three minutes of action at the end of the game.
Others: The Heat's next game is against Sacramento on Monday, followed by a rough 6-game road trip.
There is speculation about a potential trade involving Kyle Kuzma.
